author: Reuters Editorial
title: Polish Danwood puts IPO on hold amid unsatisfactory pricing
text:
WARSAW, April 25 (Reuters) - Enterprise Investors (EI) has put on hold the initial public offering of Polish housebuilder Danwood Holding ( IPO-DWH.WA ) as the price investors were ready to pay for its shares did not reflect the companyâ€™s fundamental value, Danwood said.
Danwood Holding said earlier this month that private equity fund EI planned to offer up to 20 million shares representing up to 50 percent of Danwood share capital and could additionally offer up to 4 million shares.
The maximum price was expected at 15 zloty per share.
Enterpise Investors bought Danwood in 2013 from Polish construction firm Budimex for around 240 million zlotys.
Reporting by Agnieszka Barteczko Editing by Marcin Goclowski
